Class IssueCell

java.lang.Object
javafx.scene.Node
javafx.scene.Parent
javafx.scene.layout.Region
javafx.scene.control.Control
javafx.scene.control.Labeled
javafx.scene.control.Cell<Issue>
javafx.scene.control.IndexedCell<Issue>
javafx.scene.control.ListCell<Issue>
controller.IssueCell
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget, javafx.scene.control.Skinnable
public class IssueCell extends javafx.scene.control.ListCell<Issue>
A custom ListCell implementation for displaying Issue objects inside a ListView.

The cell shows:
  • Status indicator (colored circle)
  • Issue ID (short form)
  • Title
  • Author
  • Date opened
  • Due date
The layout is built using a GridPane with percentage-based column widths.
Version:
0.2
Author:
Artur Twardzik

  • Constructor Details

    • IssueCell

      public IssueCell()
      Constructs a new IssueCell and initializes the layout, column constraints, style classes, and graphical components used to render issue information inside a ListView.

  • Method Details

    • updateItem

      protected void updateItem(Issue issue, boolean empty)
      Updates the visual representation of this cell based on the provided Issue. If the cell is empty, the graphic is cleared; otherwise, all labels and indicators are populated with data from the issue and rendered inside the preconfigured layout.
      Overrides:
      updateItem in class javafx.scene.control.Cell<Issue>
      Parameters:
      issue - the issue to display, or null if the cell is empty
      empty - whether the cell represents no data

    • getStatusColor

      private javafx.scene.paint.Color getStatusColor(BugStatus status)
      Returns the Color associated with the given BugStatus. The color is used to fill the status indicator circle in the list cell.
      Parameters:
      status - the issue status
      Returns:
      the UI color mapped to the status (e.g., green for OPEN)
